en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] ca.1824 Oct

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt, dated Thursday October 23, around the year 1824, is of two cases, one regarding and unpaid debt and the other about stolen hogs. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] ca.1824 Oct : page 1

body.value: Thursday 23 Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors. Nilly Ragsdale Ptf Plaintiff vs. The Crier Dft Defendant Jurors on a plea of debt It is the Opinion of the Court the Crier shelle Nilly Ragsdale sixty-dollars. The Old Ptf Plaintiff vs John Fields & Co Company Dft Defendant On a plea stealing hogs verdict that J Fields shall pay the Old eleven dollars
